newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: EDP to cut 2,400 jobs by year 2000.
newsitem.headline: EDP to cut 2,400 jobs by year 2000.

text.p: Portuguese state utility EDP-Electricidade de Portugal is expected to reduce its workforce by 2,400 by the year 2000, its president, Antonio de Almeida, said.

"The estimated reduction in the workforce is 2,400 by the year 2000, an average of 600 per year. This will allow us to reach the level of productivity of the Spanish companies," he said at a roadshow to promote the forthcoming privatisation of EDP. "If we want to have an impact on the Spanish market, we have to compete with Spanish utilities in terms of productivity," he added.
Almeida said no one would be fired and that the workforce would be reduced by mutual agreements between the company and employees, and by early retirement.
